titleStmt.title: Alfred C. Tanner et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Calhoon 2d Oct. 1863
To Gov. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

The Undersigned petitioners would Respectfully Represent that at the Last September Term of the MLean Circuit Court a fine wof Fifty Dollars Was adjudged against L B Lillard for Keeping a Tipling House We Want Represent that if a Tipling House Was Kept it Was Under such Circumstance that We think Executive Clemency Should be used- and Respectfully ask that the fine be Remitted.

Yours Truly[Colemon mitcake]& [Colemon mitcake]
Alf C Tann[Colemon mitcake]r
Alf. H. Edw[Colemon mitcake]rds
L. G. Alexander
Ben. H. Frankli[Colemon mitcake]
W C Mosley
Thomas C[Colemon mitcake]Tihoe [Colemon mitcake]r
Isaac N Vertre[Colemon mitcake]s
